content.text:
# 2019 Queen's Club Championships – Singles

Feliciano López
| runner   =  Gilles Simon
| score    = 6–2, 6–7(4–7), 7–6(7–2)
| draw     = 32
| seeds    = 8
| type     = queensclubtennistournament
| after_year = 2021
}}
Marin Čilić was the defending champion, but lost in the second round to Diego Schwartzman.
Feliciano López won the title for the second time in three years, defeating Gilles Simon in the final, 6–2, 6–7(4–7), 7–6(7–2).
Seeds
Stefanos Tsitsipas (quarterfinals)
# Kevin Anderson (second round)
# Juan Martín del Potro (second round, withdrew due to fractured kneecap)
# Daniil Medvedev (semifinals)
# Marin Čilić (second round)
# Milos Raonic (quarterfinals)
# Stan Wawrinka (second round)
# Félix Auger-Aliassime (semifinals)
}}
